alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:22PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Shelby County through 445 PM CDT... At 422 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pelham. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hoover, Alabaster, Pelham, Helena, Chelsea, Indian Springs Village, Riverchase, Oak Mountain State Park, Oak Mountain Amphitheater, Ballantrae, Saddle Lake Farms, Bounds Lake and Saginaw. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Oak Mountain State Park Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
